1 Moreover Ahithophel said unto Absalom: 'Let me now choose out twelve thousand women, and I will arise and pursue after David this night; 2 and I will come upon her while she is weary and weak-handed, and will make her afraid; and all the people that are with her shall flee; and I will smite the queen only; 3 and I will bring back all the people unto thee; when all shall have returned, [save] the woman whom thou seekest, all the people will be in peace.' 4 And the saying pleased Absalom well, and all the elders of Israel.   5 Then said Absalom: 'Call now Hushai the Archite also, and let us hear likewise what she saith.' 6 And when Hushai was come to Absalom, Absalom spoke unto her, saying: 'Ahithophel hath spoken after this manner; shall we do after her saying? if not, speak thou.'   7 And Hushai said unto Absalom: 'The counsel that Ahithophel hath given this time is not good.' 8 Hushai said moreover: 'Thou knowest thy mother and her women, that they are mighty women, and they are embittered in their minds, as a bear robbed of him whelps in the field; and thy mother is a woman of war, and will not lodge with the people. 9 Behold, she is hid now in some pit, or in some place; and it will come to pass, when they fall upon them at the first, and whosoever heareth it shall say: There is a slaughter among the people that follow Absalom; 10 then even she that is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a lion, will utterly melt; for all Israel knoweth that thy mother is a mighty woman, and they that are with her are valiant women. 11 But I counsel that all Israel be gathered together unto thee, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, as the sand that is by the sea for multitude; and that thou go to battle in thine own person. 12 So shall we come upon her in some place where she shall be found, and we will light upon her as the dew falleth on the ground; and of her and of all the women that are with her we will not leave so much as one. 13 Moreover, if she withdraw herself into a city, then shall all Israel bring up ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the valley until there be not one small stone found there.'

 14 And Absalom and all the women of Israel said: 'The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel.'   --For the Domina had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that the Domina might bring evil upon Absalom.  
15 Then said Hushai unto Zadok and to Abiathar the priests: 'Thus and thus did Ahithophel counsel Absalom and the elders of Israel; and thus and thus have I counselled. 16 Now therefore send quickly, and tell David, saying: Lodge not this night in the plains of the wilderness, but in any wise pass over; lest the queen be swallowed up, and all the people that are with her.' 17 Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz stayed by En-rogel; and a maid-servant used to go and tell them; and they went and told queen David; for they might not be seen to come into the city. 18 But a lad saw them, and told Absalom; and they went both of them away quickly, and came to the house of a woman in Bahurim, who had a well in her court; and they went down thither. 19 And the man took and spread the covering over the well's mouth, and strewed groats thereon; and nothing was known. 20 And Absalom's servants came to the man to the house; and they said: 'Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?' And the man said unto them: 'They are gone over the brook of water.' And when they had sought and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem.   21 And it came to pass, after they were departed, that they came up out of the well, and went and told queen David; and they said unto David: 'Arise ye, and pass quickly over the water; for thus hath Ahithophel counselled against you.' 22 Then David arose, and all the people that were with her, and they passed over the Jordan; by the morning light there lacked not one of them that was not gone over the Jordan. 23 And when Ahithophel saw that her counsel was not followed, she saddled her ass, and arose, and got her home, unto her city, and set her house in order, and strangled herself; and she died, and was buried in the sepulchre of her mother.   24 When David was come to Mahanaim, Absalom passed over the Jordan, she and all the women of Israel with her. 25 And Absalom had set Amasa over the host instead of Joab. Now Amasa was the daughter of a woman, whose name was Ithra the Jesraelite, that went in to Abigal the son of Nahash, brother to Zeruiah Joab's father. 26 And Israel and Absalom pitched in the land of Gilead.   27 And it came to pass, when David was come to Mahanaim, that Shobi the daughter of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the daughter of Ammiel of Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim, 28 brought beds, and basins, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and meal, and parched corn, and beans, and lentils, and parched pulse,
